chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Hospital waiting room — nighttime, artificial lighting from overhead fixtures and windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark-colored suit jacket - striped shirt - patterned tie - dark, short hair - serious expression
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated expression
Rachel Green: white t-shirt - dark overalls - brown, shoulder-length hair - concerned expression
Chandler Bing: purple t-shirt under dark blue zip-up hoodie - dark pants - dark, styled hair - relaxed expression
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored hoodie - dark pants - dark, styled hair - surprised expression
Phoebe Buffay: orange jacket - dark pants - blonde, long hair - concerned expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller stands and gestures animatedly while talking to Monica Geller, who responds while walking toward him. Rachel Green sits on a chair, looking concerned and gesturing with her hands as she speaks. Chandler Bing sits in a chair, holding a magazine and reacting with surprise to the conversation. Joey Tribbiani stands up from his chair and walks toward the group, looking surprised. Phoebe Buffay enters the room and joins the conversation, looking concerned.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Magazine: held by Chandler Bing
- Chairs: multiple light-colored chairs arranged in the room
- Coffee table: wooden, with magazines on it
- Wall decor: framed paintings on the walls
- Bulletin board: with papers pinned to it

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses the situation with Monica Geller, who appears concerned. The conversation has a tense tone, with Ross appearing serious and Monica reacting with concern. Rachel Green speaks with a worried expression, gesturing as she talks. Chandler Bing reacts with surprise to the conversation, while Joey Tribbiani enters the room looking surprised.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
- Joey Tribbiani stands up from his chair and walks toward the group
- Phoebe Buffay enters the room from the right side
- Monica Geller walks toward Ross Geller
- Chandler Bing holds a magazine and reacts with surprise
- Rachel Green gestures with her hands while speaking
chunk_00001.subtitles: WOMAN [OVER PA]: Dr. Johnson, you have a call on line 7. She's not here yet. She's having my baby and she's not here. - Everything's fine. Has her water broken? - I don't know. But when I spoke to her, she said she'd already passed the mucus plug. [GROANS] Do we have to know about that? What are you gonna do when you have a baby? I'm gonna be in the waiting room, handing out cigars. Yes, Joey's made arrangements to have his baby in a movie from the '50s. Aah, I don't believe this. I mean, she could be giving birth in the cab. Oh, Ross, relax. It's only like $2 for the first contraction... ...and then 50 cents each additional contraction. What, it's okay when Chandler does it? You have to pick your moments. - Hi. Did I miss it? Did I miss it? - No, she's not even here yet. - Oh. MONICA: What's with the guitar? I just thought we might be here for a while, so, you know, things might get musical.

chunk_00002.subtitles: I just thought we might be here for a while, so, you know, things might get musical. [ROSS SHOUTS] ROSS: Hey, where the hell have you been? - We stopped at the gift shop. I was looking at stuffed animals, and Susan wanted a Chunky. Susan wanted a... You're having a baby. A baby. You don't stop for Chunkys. - I used to have that bumper sticker. - Ha, ha. You see what I mean?

chunk_00003.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Hospital room — daytime, fluorescent lighting

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: light-colored striped shirt - dark-colored pants - dark, short hair - concerned expression
Rachel Green: dark-colored hoodie - light-colored patterned skirt - brown, shoulder-length hair - animated expression
Carol: light-colored hospital gown with dark polka dots - blonde, braided hair - smiling expression
Dr. Franzblau: white lab coat - dark pants - dark, short hair - professional expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green stands beside the hospital bed, holding a yellow cup and talking to Carol, who is seated in the bed. Ross Geller stands near the bed, gesturing with his hand as he speaks to Dr. Franzblau, who is writing on a clipboard. Dr. Franzblau then turns to speak to Ross and Rachel, who are both looking at him. Carol smiles and laughs as she interacts with Rachel.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Yellow cup: held by Rachel Green
- Clipboard: held by Dr. Franzblau
- Hospital bed: with Carol seated in it
- Wall-mounted sign: indicating "WAITING ROOMS", "NURSERY", and "ELEVATORS"

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses the baby's birth with Dr. Franzblau, who is checking the medical records. Rachel Green interacts with Carol, who is smiling and laughing. The conversation has a casual tone, with Rachel appearing animated and Ross appearing concerned.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel Green enters the room and approaches Carol, holding a yellow cup. Dr. Franzblau enters the room and begins writing on a clipboard. Ross Geller gestures with his hand as he speaks to Dr. Franzblau.
chunk_00003.subtitles: - "Stopped for a Chunky." - Let it go, Ross. I got an extra one. You want this? No. Hey, how's my favorite parenting team doing? Dr. Franzblau. Hi. So I understand you're thinking of having a baby. Wow. I see you're nine months pregnant. That's a good start. [CAROL CHUCKLES] - How you doing with your contractions? - Oh, I love them. Each one's like a little party in my uterus. Ha, ha. They're every four minutes and last 55 seconds. Fifty-nine seconds. Quartz. Ha. Swiss quartz. Ha, ha. - Am I allowed to drink anything? - Ice chips, just ice chips. - They're at the nurses' station. - I'll get them. SUSAN: No, I'm getting it. Be right back. - No, I got it. I'm getting it. Hi. Thought you might like some ice chips. CAROL: Thanks. And if you need anything else, I...

Unidentified person: light-colored shirt - dark pants - dark hair - serious expression

Joey Tribbiani wakes up from sleeping
Unidentified woman enters the room
Joey Tribbiani stands up from chair
Unidentified woman gestures while talking to Joey
chunk_00004.subtitles: And if you need anything else, I... ...do not believe we have met. Hi. I'm Rachel Green. I'm Carol's ex-husband's sister's roommate. Ha, ha. It's nice to meet you. I'm Dr. Franzblau. I'm your roommate's brother's ex-wife's obstetrician. [LAUGHS] Oh, that's funny. I want a baby. Hmm. Not tonight, honey. I got an early day tomorrow. Get up. Come on, let's get some coffee. Oh, okay, because we never do that. Shoot, shoot, shoot. Or just fall down. That's good too. LYDIA: Knick fan? JOEY: Oh, yeah. - Oh, boy, do they suck. - Hey, listen, lady, I... Whoa. Look. Look at your man Ewing. Nice shot. You know, he couldn't hit water if he was standing on a boat. Oh, yeah? And who do you like? - Celtics. - Celtics? Ha!

chunk_00005.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Hospital waiting room — nighttime, artificial lighting from overhead fixtures and wall sconces.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Unidentified person: dark-colored sweater - dark pants - dark, styled hair - concerned expression
Unidentified person: maroon dress - patterned skirt - dark hair tied back - expression shifts from calm to distressed
Phoebe Buffay: black long-sleeved top - black pants - long blonde hair - smiling while playing guitar
Chandler Bing: dark-colored hoodie - dark pants - brown hair - relaxed, listening expression
Joey Tribbiani: light-colored shirt - dark pants - brown hair - expression shifts from relaxed to concerned
Ross Geller: light-colored shirt - dark pants - brown hair - expression shifts from relaxed to concerned
Rachel Green: green jacket - dark pants - brown hair - expression shifts from relaxed to concerned
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - dark pants - dark hair - expression shifts from relaxed to concerned

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
An unidentified pregnant woman sits on a couch, visibly distressed and clutching her stomach, while an unidentified man in a dark sweater gestures animatedly and then stands to help her. They exit the waiting room together. Later, the group gathers in the waiting room, where Phoebe Buffay sits on a couch playing an acoustic guitar and singing. Chandler Bing and Joey Tribbiani sit nearby, listening. Ross Geller, Rachel Green, and Monica Geller stand or sit around the room, reacting to Phoebe's performance. The group appears engaged and amused by the music.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Acoustic guitar: light-colored wood (being played by Phoebe Buffay)
- Wooden coffee table: center of room
- Couches: multiple, light-colored fabric
- Wall-mounted bulletin board: with papers and notices
- Phone booth: visible on wall

- Window: with vertical blinds, showing city lights outside

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Phoebe Buffay sings a folk song about parenting to the group. The conversation has a lighthearted, humorous tone, with Phoebe appearing cheerful and animated while singing, and the listeners reacting with smiles and amusement. The song's lyrics about parenting challenges are met with laughter and playful responses from the group.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Unidentified pregnant woman stands up and walks toward the OB/GYN waiting room door with the unidentified man.
Phoebe Buffay begins playing guitar and singing.
Chandler Bing and Joey Tribbiani shift their positions to sit closer to the couch where Phoebe is playing.
Ross Geller, Rachel Green, and Monica Geller move around the room to find seats or stand near the group.
chunk_00005.subtitles: - Celtics. - Celtics? Ha! They couldn't hit a boat if... Wait. They suck, all right? Shut up. You know, it's a rebuilding year. You... - Aah! Aah! - Oh. Aah. Uh, let me get the father. Hey! We need a father over here! We need a father! There's no father. Oh. Oh. Oh, sorry. Oh, that's okay. I'm fine. I'm... - Oh! - Oh, uh... Okay. All right. Uh, right this way. All the other pregnant women seem to be going in here. Okay. [PLAYING FOLK MUSIC] [SINGING] They're tiny and chubby And so sweet to touch But soon they'll grow up And resent you so much Now they're yelling at you And you don't know why And you cry and you cry and you cry - Thanks, Ross. - Yeah. I'm paying you to stop.

chunk_00006.caption:

A waiting room or common area — daytime, bright natural light from large windows.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**

Chandler Bing: dark blue zip-up hoodie over purple t-shirt - dark pants - dark, styled hair - animated, gesturing expression

Phoebe Buffay: black top - black pants - blonde, long hair - smiling, holding a guitar
Unidentified person: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - dark hair - background, partially visible

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica stands with arms crossed, speaking animatedly to Chandler who is seated and gesturing back. Rachel enters, looking at her watch and speaking to Monica. Phoebe sits on a couch holding a guitar, smiling. Chandler leans back in his chair, then stands up and walks away. Monica follows him, continuing to speak.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**

- Wooden table: center of frame, with magazines

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Chandler discusses hypothetical marriage plans with Monica, who appears concerned and skeptical. The conversation has a tense, joking tone, with Chandler appearing animated and Monica reacting with frustration. Rachel enters and joins the conversation, looking at her watch.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Chandler stands up and walks away from his chair
Monica follows Chandler, continuing to speak
Rachel enters the frame from the right side
Phoebe remains seated, holding her guitar throughout
chunk_00006.subtitles: - Thanks, Ross. - Yeah. I'm paying you to stop. Okay. Oh, look, twins. Hi, guys. Oh, cute, cute. No fair. I don't even have one. How come they get two? - You'll get one. - Oh, yeah? When? CHANDLER: I'll tell you what. When we're 40, if neither of us are married... ...what do you say you and I have one? Why won't I be married when I'm 40? Oh, no, no, no. I just meant hypothetically. Okay, hypothetically, why won't I be married when I'm 40? - No, no, no. - No, no, what is it? Seriously. Is there something fundamentally unmarriable about me? - Uh... Uh... - Well? Dear God. This parachute is a knapsack. - Hey. - Hey. Ooh. - Look at you, dressy-dress. - Yeah. Did you go home and change? Yeah, well, it's an important day. I wanna look nice. Um, has Dr. Franzblau been by?

chunk_00007.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — daytime, natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: dark-colored top - dark pants - brown, shoulder-length hair - concerned expression
Chandler Bing: purple t-shirt with graphic - dark blue hoodie - dark, styled hair - serious expression
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - smiling expression
Unidentified person: light-colored shirt - unclear pants - dark hair - seated in background

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green stands near Chandler Bing, who is seated and holding a guitar. Joey Tribbiani stands nearby, smiling. Rachel Green walks toward a doorway, then turns back to face Chandler Bing. Chandler Bing follows her, and they have a conversation near a wall. The scene transitions to a hospital room where Chandler Bing stands beside a bed, talking to a woman lying in the bed. The woman picks up a phone and begins talking, while Chandler Bing listens and then takes the phone from her.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
Guitar: wooden, being held by Chandler Bing
Phone: white, landline, being used by the woman in bed
Hospital bed: white, with floral-patterned curtains
Window: with blinds, behind the bed
Wall: plain, with a whiteboard and a "Phone" sign

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel Green discusses a situation with Chandler Bing, who appears serious. The conversation shifts to a hospital room where a woman in bed talks on the phone, and Chandler Bing listens. The woman appears to be discussing a personal matter, possibly related to a baby, as indicated by the subtitles. The tone is tense and serious, with the woman appearing anxious and Chandler Bing appearing concerned.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel Green walks toward a doorway and then turns back to face Chandler Bing.
Chandler Bing follows Rachel Green and they have a conversation near a wall.
The scene transitions to a hospital room.
The woman in bed picks up the phone and begins talking.
Chandler Bing takes the phone from her.
chunk_00007.subtitles: No, I haven't seen him. Well, where is he? He is supposed to be here. What if the baby needs him? Rachel, what is the deal with you and doctors? - Is, like, your father a doctor? - Yeah. Why? No reason. Mom, we've been through this. No, I am not calling him. I don't care if it is his kid. The guy's a jerk. No, I am not alone. Joey's here. What do you mean, "Joey who?" [MOUTHS] Joey who? - Tribbiani. - Joey Tribbiani. Yes. Okay. Hold on. - She wants to talk to you. - No. Take the phone. Hi. Yeah, it's me. [JOEY CHUCKLES] Oh, no, no, no. We're just friends. Yeah. Yeah, I'm single. Twenty-five.

chunk_00008.caption:

Hospital room — daytime, bright artificial lighting

Unidentified person: light-colored hospital gown - dark hair - expression of surprise and concern

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Joey Tribbiani stands by the hospital bed, initially smiling while on the phone, then turns serious as he interacts with the person in the bed. He gestures with his hands while talking and eventually walks away from the bed. The person in the bed holds a baby wrapped in a blanket and reacts with surprise and concern as Joey leaves. Later, Joey returns and adjusts the pillow behind the person in the bed.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Hospital bed: with white sheets and pillow
- Telephone: white, corded, held by Joey
- Baby: wrapped in white blanket

Joey Tribbiani discusses the situation with the person in the hospital bed, who appears surprised and concerned. The conversation has a tense tone, with Joey appearing serious and the person in the bed reacting with shock and worry.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Joey Tribbiani walks away from the bed and returns to adjust the pillow.
chunk_00008.subtitles: Twenty-five. An actor. Hello? - She's not much of a phone person. - Yeah. So, uh, what's the deal with this father guy? I mean, if someone was having my baby somewhere, I'd wanna know about it. Hey, Knick fan, am I interested in your views on fatherhood? Um, no. Okay. Uh, look, maybe I should just go. - Maybe you should. - Good luck. And, uh, take care, huh? Know what the Celtics' problem is? They let the players run the team. Oh, that is so not true. - Oh, it is. It is. - It isn't. Isn't. - Breathe. Breathe. Breathe. - Breathe. Breathe. Breathe. You're gonna kill me! - Fifteen more seconds. Fourteen, 13, 12... - Count faster. It's gonna be okay. We're doing it for Jordy. Keep focusing on Jordy. Who the hell is Jordy?

chunk_00009.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Hospital room — daytime, bright artificial lighting
Medical equipment and hospital bed are visible, indicating a clinical setting.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: light-colored striped shirt - brown pants - dark, short hair - animated, expressive
Unidentified person: dark-colored top - unclear lower clothing - blonde, shoulder-length hair - concerned, then smiling
Unidentified person: dark-colored top - unclear lower clothing - dark, shoulder-length hair - concerned, then smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller stands and gestures animatedly while talking to two women in a hospital room. One woman, in a hospital gown, appears to be in labor and is holding her stomach, while the other woman, in a dark sweater, stands beside her, holding her hand and speaking. Ross moves around the bed, at one point touching the woman in the gown, and later walks away from the bed toward a door. The two women remain by the bed, interacting with each other and the patient.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Hospital bed: white sheets, with patient lying in it
- Medical equipment: visible on wall and near bed
- Picture frame: on wall behind bed
- Cabinet: wooden, with drawers, near bed
- Window: with blinds, on right side of room
- Potted plant: on dresser near window

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses the name of a child with the two women, expressing confusion and frustration. The conversation has a tense, joking tone, with Ross appearing animated and the women reacting with concern and amusement. The dialogue revolves around the name "Jordy" and the disagreement over the baby's name.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross Geller walks away from the bed toward a door
Ross Geller returns to the bed and interacts with the patient
The scene shifts to a different hospital room with a different patient and a different woman in a hospital gown
chunk_00009.subtitles: Who the hell is Jordy? - Your son. - Whoa, whoa whoa. I don't have a son named Jordy. We all agreed, my son's name is Jamie. Well, Jamie was the name of Susan's first girlfriend... ...so we went back to Jordy. Whoa, whoa, whoa. What do you mean, "back to Jordy"? We never landed on Jordy. We just passed by it during the whole Jesse/Cody/Dillon fiasco. Ow, ow, ow! - What? What? What? - Leg cramp, leg cramp. ROSS: I got it. I got it. - I got it. I'm doing it. You get to sleep with her. I get the cramps. No, you don't. - That is it. I want both of you out. - What? - She started it. - He started it. I don't care. I'm trying to get a person out of my body here... ...and you're not making it any easier. Now go! - Thanks a lot. - See what you did? - Yeah. Listen... - Out. Breathe. Breathe. Breathe. Oh, no. Ew.

chunk_00010.caption:

Hospital delivery room — daytime, fluorescent lighting

Ross Geller: light-colored striped shirt - brown pants - dark, short hair - surprised expression
Rachel Green: dark-colored hoodie - curly brown hair in ponytail - animated expression
Phoebe Buffay: black dress - long blonde hair - holding guitar - concerned expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Joey stands beside the hospital bed, holding a baby wrapped in a blanket, looking down with concern. The nurse interacts with the patient in bed, then turns to speak to Joey. Ross enters from a doorway, looking surprised, and begins arguing with Rachel, who is standing nearby. Phoebe enters holding a guitar and joins the conversation, trying to calm them down. Ross crosses his arms and listens as Phoebe speaks, while Rachel looks on with a concerned expression.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Baby: wrapped in white blanket (in Joey's hands)
- Hospital bed: with white sheets and pillows

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses the situation with Rachel Green, who is visibly upset. The conversation has a tense tone, with Ross appearing defensive and Rachel animatedly arguing. Phoebe Buffay intervenes, trying to calm them down, and appears concerned as she speaks to them.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross Geller enters the room from the doorway
Phoebe Buffay enters holding a guitar
Rachel Green moves closer to Ross Geller during their argument
Phoebe Buffay steps back toward the doorway
chunk_00010.subtitles: Ew. What is that? Something exploded. It's just her water breaking. Calm down, will you? Water breaking? What do you mean? What's that, water breaking? Breathe. Breathe. Breathe. - Oh, please. This is so your fault. - How? How is this my fault? Look, Carol never threw me out of a room before you came along. Well, there's a lot of things Carol never did before I came along. - Are you trying to be clever? - You are so threatened by me. - Everything I say is a problem. PHOEBE: Hey, hey, hey. Okay. All right. That's it. Get in here. Come on. My God, you guys. I don't believe you. There are children coming into the world in this very building... ...and your fighting noises are not the first thing they should be hearing. So just stop all the yelling! Just stop it! Yeah, Susan. Don't make me do this again! I don't like my voice like this! Okay, who wants to hear something ironic?

chunk_00011.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**

Rachel Green: dark-colored dress - shoulder-length brown hair - smiling expression
Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored top - long blonde hair - animated expression

Unidentified person: dark-colored top - long brown hair - concerned expression
Unidentified person: white lab coat - dark hair - professional expression
Unidentified person: dark-colored top - dark hair - concerned expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are initially in a cluttered storage room, reacting with concern as they try to open a door. Ross falls to the floor, holding a broom handle. The scene shifts to a hospital room where Rachel stands beside a patient in a hospital gown, holding an orange juice. A doctor in a white coat speaks to the patient while Rachel holds the juice. Ross enters the room, leaning over the patient's bed, gesturing animatedly as he speaks to her. The patient appears to be in labor, with a nurse assisting her.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Orange juice: orange (in Rachel's hand)
- Hospital gown: white with blue polka dots (on patient)
- White lab coat: (on doctor)
- Broom handle: light-colored (in Ross's hand)
- Medical equipment: various (in hospital room)
- Storage items: various (in storage room)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses the situation with the patient and the doctor, appearing concerned and animated. Rachel holds an orange juice and listens to the conversation. The tone is tense and serious, with Ross appearing worried and the patient appearing in pain. The doctor speaks calmly, providing reassurance.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross falls to the floor, holding a broom handle.
The scene transitions to a hospital room.
Ross enters the hospital room and leans over the patient's bed.
Rachel holds an orange juice and listens to the conversation.
chunk_00011.subtitles: Okay, who wants to hear something ironic? PHOEBE & SUSAN: Help! ROSS: Come on! PHOEBE & SUSAN: Help! ROSS: I'm having a baby in there! SUSAN: Hello? - Help! ROSS: Okay, everyone stand back. Ow. Are they here yet? No, honey, but don't worry, we're gonna find them. And until we do, we are all here for you, okay? - Okay. Okay. RACHEL: Okay? Anyway, you were telling me about Paris. It sounds wonderful. It really was. There was this great little pastry shop right by my hotel... [CAROL YELLING] There you go, dear. You... Come on, Lydia, you can do it. Push. Push him out, push him out. Harder, harder. Push him out, push him out. Way out. Let's get that ball and really move. Hey, hey. Ho, ho. Let's get... I was just... Yeah, okay.

chunk_00013.subtitles: - Where have you been? JOEY: Oh, I just had a baby. Mazel tov. I don't know. It could be an hour, it could be three. But relax, she's doing great. So, uh, tell me, are you currently involved with anyone? No. No, not at... At the moment, no, I'm not, no. - Are you? - No, no. It's hard enough to get women to go out with me. Heh. Right, yeah, I've heard that about cute doctors. No, no, really. I suppose it's because I spend so much time, you know... ...where I do. - Oh. - Mm. I try not to let work affect my personal life, but it's hard when you do... ...what I do. It's like, uh... Well, for instance, what do you do? - I'm a waitress. - Okay, all right. Well, aren't there times when you come home at the end of the day...

Inside, Ross peeks through the door while Rachel sits on a couch reading a magazine. Ross then enters the room, where a woman in a hospital gown holds a baby, and a man sits beside her. chunk_00014.subtitles: Well, aren't there times when you come home at the end of the day... ...and you're just like, "If I see one more cup of coffee..." Ahem. Yeah. Gotcha. - I'm gonna check up on your friend. - Okay, that's fine. - So how did you know I was even here? ROY: Your mom called me. So is this her? No, this is a loaner. Listen, I'm sorry you had to do this by yourself. Oh. I wasn't by myself. I had a doctor, a nurse and a helper guy. So did you see who won the game? Yeah, Knicks by 10. They suck. Eh, they're not so bad.

chunk_00015.caption:

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: light-colored striped shirt - dark pants - dark, short hair - animated, frustrated expression
Monica Geller: dark-colored top - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair tied back - concerned expression
Rachel Green: dark-colored top - dark pants - blonde, long hair - seated, listening expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross enters the utility closet, visibly agitated, and begins arguing with Monica and Rachel. He gestures emphatically while speaking, expressing frustration about being stuck in the closet while his son is being born. Monica responds with a concerned expression, gesturing as she speaks back to Ross. Rachel remains seated, listening to the conversation.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Balloons: colorful, attached to wall (hallway)
- Baby-themed balloon: large, shaped like a bottle with a rocket, on the floor (hallway)
- Shelves: holding cleaning supplies and paper towels (closet)
- Red circular decoration: on wall (closet)
- Blue trash can: in corner (closet)
- Guitar: leaning against wall (closet)
- Red hose: coiled on floor (closet)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses his frustration about being stuck in the closet while his son is being born, blaming Monica. The conversation has a tense, emotional tone, with Ross appearing animated and frustrated, and Monica reacting with concern. Rachel listens quietly, seated nearby.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross enters the utility closet from the hallway.
Ross begins gesturing and speaking animatedly.
Monica responds, gesturing as she speaks.
Rachel remains seated throughout the scene.
chunk_00015.subtitles: ROSS: Come on. Come on. Damn it, damn it, damn it. This is all your fault. This is supposed to be, like, the greatest day of my life. My son is being born, and I should be in there, you know? Instead I'm stuck in a closet with you. I've been waiting for this just as much as you have. Believe me, no one has been waiting for this as much as I have, okay? And you know what the funny thing is? When this day is over, you get to go home with the baby. - Where does that leave me? - You get to be the father. Everyone knows who you are. Who am I? There's Father's Day. There's Mother's Day. There's no Lesbian Lover Day. Every day is Lesbian Lover Day. This is so great.

chunk_00016.subtitles: You wanna explain that? I mean, well, because when I was growing up, you know, my dad left... ...and my mother died, and my stepfather went to jail. So I barely had enough pieces of parents to make one whole one. And here's this little baby who has like three whole parents... ...who care about it so much that they fight over who gets to love it the most... ...and it's not even born yet. It's just the luckiest baby in the whole world. I'm sorry. You were fighting. Where are they? - I'm sure they'll be here soon. - They wouldn't miss this. Relax. You're only at nine centimeters, and the baby's at zero station. Okay, you are really frightening me. [CAROL SCREAMS] Somebody wanna help me? Trying to rip out my heart. Uh... Oh, that's great. Anybody seen a nipple?

chunk_00017.subtitles: Uh... Oh, that's great. Anybody seen a nipple? All right. Ten centimeters. Here we go. - All right, honey, time to start pushing. - But they're not here yet. Sorry, I can't tell the baby to wait for them. Oh, God. [ROSS GRUNTS] Okay, got the vent open. Hi, I'm Ben. [CHUCKLES] I'm hospital worker Ben. It's Ben to the rescue. - [SINGING] La, la, la - Okay, okay, okay. - Ben, you ready? - Yeah. - All right, give me your foot. - Okay. - Okay, on three, Ben. One, two, three. Unh. PHOEBE: Ooh. - Come on, Ben. Okay. That's it, Ben. PHOEBE: Okay. Uh-huh. SUSAN: What do you see? PHOEBE: Well, Susan, I see what appears to be a dark vent. Wait. Yes, it is, in fact, a dark vent. [ROSS & SUSAN GASPING] Pheebs, it's open! It's open!

chunk_00018.subtitles: Wait! You forgot your legs! ALL: Push. Push. - We're here! [ALL SHOUTING INDISTINCTLY] ROSS: We're here. - Where have you been?! Long story, honey. FRANZBLAU: All right, Carol, I need you to keep pushing. I need... Excuse me, can I have this? Oh, sorry. All right, all right. There's too many people in this room. There's about to be one more. So anybody who's not an ex-husband or a lesbian life partner, out you go. - Come on, out. RACHEL: Okay, good luck. - Bye, bye, bye. - Good luck, you guys, good luck. Let me ask you, do you have to be Carol's lesbian life partner? NURSE: Out. FRANZBLAU: All right. All right, he's crowning. Here he comes. Let me see. I gotta see, I gotta see. Oh... Oh. Oh! A head. Oh. It's huge. Carol, how are you doing this? Not helping. FRANZBLAU: You're doing great. You're doing fine.

Oh, a chest and a stomach... ...and it's a boy, definitely a boy. All right. Okay, legs, knees and feet. Oh, oh. [GASPING] He's here. He's... He's a person. Oh! - Look at that. - What does he look like? Kind of like my Uncle Ed, covered in Jell-O. Really? PHOEBE [FROM ABOVE]: You guys, he's beautiful. Aw, thanks, Pheebs. No shouting, but we still need a name for this little guy. How about Ben? I like Ben. Ben.
